column2: The best way to fight Scoia'tael is using their own tactics - a small mobile unit capable of tracking them down. Of course it also needs enough authority to take command of local forces when the Scoia'tael is finally cornered. A problem with such unit is that it's hard to keep track of it, so a trustworthy commander is a necessity.

[Root.GetTitledName],

I wish to inform you that I have managed to stop Scoia'tael activity in [From.GetName], most of their leader died or was captured and swiftly executed.

[FromFrom.GetFullName]

[FromFrom.GetFullName] went to [From.GetName] to stop Scoia'tael opperations in the area. There haven't been any news from [FromFrom.GetHerHim] or [FromFrom.GetHerHis] subordinates, but there are still news about Scoia'tael activity. Sadly it can only mean that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] perished during [FromFrom.GetHerHis] duty.
